chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 17-year-old male with HIV who developed jaundice and elevated liver enzymes after one year on efavirenz-based therapy. Peak lab values include ALT at 1,550.88 U/L, AST at 1,304.42 U/L, ALP at 297.9 U/L, total bilirubin at 213.6 umol/L, and later bilirubin increased to 432.2 umol/L. INR and albumin are not mentioned. The suspected drug is efavirenz. After discontinuation of efavirenz and treatment with corticosteroids and mycophenolate mofetil, liver enzymes normalized over a year, indicating improvement. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged.
